Class QuizGameView

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
view.QuizGameView
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class QuizGameView extends javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
QuizGameView class represents the graphical user interface for a quiz game. It displays the game board, player information, and quiz questions.

  • Nested Class Summary

    static interface 
    QuizGameView.Observer
    Observer interface for handling game events.

  • Constructor Details

    • QuizGameView

      public QuizGameView(BoardGame game, FullscreenHandler fullscreenHandler)
      Constructor for QuizGameView. Initializes the view with the game, fullscreen handler, and styles.
      Parameters:
      game - the BoardGame instance
      fullscreenHandler - the FullscreenHandler instance

  • Method Details

    • updateView

      public void updateView()
      Updates the view with the current game state. This includes updating the current player, dice values, and player pieces on the board.

    • showGame

      public void showGame()
      Shows the game where the categories are invisible and the grid is visible. The questions are hidden until a player lands on a question tile.

    • setObserver

      public void setObserver(QuizGameView.Observer obs)
      Setter for the observer.

    • showQuestion

      public void showQuestion(String question, List<String> options)
      Called when a player lands on a question tile.

    • hideQuestion

      public void hideQuestion()
      Hides the question pane and shows the game board.

    • setQuestionTiles

      public void setQuestionTiles(Set<Integer> questionTileIds)
      Sets the question tile IDs and builds the board grid.
      Parameters:
      questionTileIds - the set of question tile IDs

    • updateDice

      public void updateDice(int die1Value, int die2Value)
      Updates the dice images based on the rolled values.
      Parameters:
      die1Value - the value of the first die
      die2Value - the value of the second die
